ingredients.ingredient: 4 whole fresh sage leaves (plus 2-3 tsp chopped sage)
4 thin slices prosciutto (or more or less as needed)
More butter as needed to help thicken final sauce (optional)

procedure.step: Place the chicken cutlets on top of a sheet of plastic wrap and place one fresh sage leaf of top of each one, top each one with a thin layer of prosciutto, place another sheet of plastic wrap on top and use a meat hammer or rolling pin to pound the chicken so that the prosciutto adheres.
Add a good splash of olive oil to a large heavy bottomed pan on medium high heat and, when the oil is hot; carefully add the chicken...prosciutto side down.
Once the prosciutto has crisped up nicely, flip the chicken and keep cooking it on the second side.
Take the chicken out of the pan and let it rest on a clean plate, it doesn't need to be cooked all the way through at this point because you will finish cooking it in the sauce later on.
Add a dollop of butter to the pan and then add 6-8 ounces of sliced mushrooms and about 1/4 cup finely diced onion and 2-3 tsp fresh chopped sage and get those going.
Once the mushrooms have cooked down a bit, add 1/2 cup Marsala wine and 1/2 cup chicken stock turn the heat to high and let it cook down to a sauce consistency.
When the sauce is just about there, add the chicken back to the pan to finish cooking through and it's time to eat.

Recipe.hints: Serve with rice or simple olive oil dress pasta. Depending on how hungry you are….you may want more than one cutlet per serving.
